p: Studies have described the inhibitory activity of essential oils on human parasites (reviewed by Sharifi-Rad etÂ al. 2017), and recently on Leishmania, providing a promising source of new drugs. Here, we aimed to characterize the essential oils from N. amazonum Nees, N. gardneri Meisn., N. hihua (Ruiz & Pav.) Rohwer and N. megapotamica (Spreng.) Mez, and to evaluate their cytotoxicity and activity against Leishmania ( Leishmania) infantum and L. ( L.) amazonensis. These parasites are the respective aetiological agents of visceral and cutaneous leishmaniasis (VL and CL) in the Americas (Ready 2014).
